title: Spivey Sisters: Complete Recorded Works 1929-1937
description:
eac secure cue log scans

Original Release / RST Records / JPCD-1506-02 / CD

The Spivey Sisters (Sweet Pease & The Za Zu Girl): Complete Recorded Works In Chronological Order (1929-1937) [1996] 

Although Victoria Spivey gained a certain amount of fame with her early blues vocals (she was an active force into the 1960s), her two sisters, whose complete work is on this CD, are much more obscure. Addie "Sweet Pease" Spivey is backed by a quartet with trumpeter Red Allen in 1929 on four numbers, and by a variety of Chicago-based musicians during 1936-37, while The Za Zu Girl (Elton Island Spivey) only had one four-song session. Both singers are somewhat limited but the backup musicians (which include trumpeter Lee Collins, pianist Althea Dickerson, and mandolinist Charley McCoy) uplift the music. An interesting historical set from the Austrian RST labe
